subject: Read default power mode & IPS parameters from DBus
commitMessage:
Read default power mode & IPS parameters from DBus

If the power mode or idle power saver parameters have never been set,
they will be read from a set of default parameters that are on DBus.
This allows individual systems to have different default settings.
Mode/IPS parameters moved from Settings to OCC.Control

Code verified on Everest hardware with multiple scenarios including
host reboots, BMC reboots, OCC resets.

Change-Id: Id02613455db7f382791ff37c7dc420dbea1e0906
Signed-off-by: Chris Cain <cjcain@us.ibm.com>

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 1be4337b390fbcb951ee3c5c15f1a5a54a2dd205
It would be nice to have some use case flows or a walk through on interface actions for education,,,   or something like that.
You don't need an object manager per path endpoint in /xyz.  You can just put it at a common parent.

Objects use: 
/xyz/openbmc_project/control/host0/power_mode
/xyz/openbmc_project/control/host0/power_ips
So I can use "/xyz/openbmc_project/control" (since it is common for both).
This will the org.freedesktop.DBus.ObjectManager interface on dbus on that path.

Done
you're already in this namespace, so I don't think you explicitly need to have it here if you don't want to.
It was not building when I didn't have the full namespace.  I will try to remove again and see if it builds.

this hardcodes the path again that only works on everest?  If you make a 'GetSubTree' mapper method call and pass in your interface, it will return the object path and service it is on and then it'll always work.
I totally missed that Everest in the path when I copied the interface.  Good catch.

You can use the propertiesChangedNamespace() rule to match on a path namespace when you don't know the actual path, since as it is now what you have just works on the everest path:
               sdbusplus::bus::match::rules::propertiesChangedNamespace(
                   "/xyz/openbmc_project/inventory", <interface>),
maybe add 'Match' onto this like the others
I had defaultsMatch, but was thinking that sounded strange because it is called when the defaults get updated.  I can make it defaultsUpdateMatch.

The normal use of GetSubTree is to find all the paths that provide a certain interface, such as all the sensors using xyz.openbmc_project.Sensor.Value.  It's pretty much the same as getSubTreePaths() (only returns object paths) above but with different return signature (returns object paths and service names/interfaces).  

So I think to be consistent and make it more useful for future callers, it would be better to just have it return 'Objects' and let the caller pull out what they want.
Discussed more and settled on renaming function to make it clearer.
This is ready for review again.
